io.cdap.http.internal

Class ParamConvertUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cdap.http.internal.ParamConvertUtils

  • public final class ParamConvertUtils
extends Object
    Util class to convert request parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<List<String>,Object> createHeaderParamConverter(Type resultType)
      Creates a converter function that converts header value into an object of the given result type.
      static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<String,Object> createPathParamConverter(Type resultType)
      Creates a converter function that converts a path segment into the given result type.
      static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<List<String>,Object> createQueryParamConverter(Type resultType)
      Creates a converter function that converts query parameter into an object of the given result type.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createPathParamConverter

        public static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<String,Object> createPathParamConverter(Type resultType)
        Creates a converter function that converts a path segment into the given result type. Current implementation doesn't follow the PathParam specification to maintain backward compatibility.

      • createHeaderParamConverter

        public static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<List<String>,Object> createHeaderParamConverter(Type resultType)
        Creates a converter function that converts header value into an object of the given result type. It follows the supported types of HeaderParam with the following exceptions:
        1. Does not support types registered with ParamConverterProvider

      • createQueryParamConverter

        public static io.cdap.http.internal.Converter<List<String>,Object> createQueryParamConverter(Type resultType)
        Creates a converter function that converts query parameter into an object of the given result type. It follows the supported types of QueryParam with the following exceptions:
        1. Does not support types registered with ParamConverterProvider
